ooo_row.column_2: value

“I’ve sailed the whole world, but my time has come. The treasure I leave is small, but is valuable beyond compare. If you believe yourself worthy of my legacy, start your journey by going inside my old ship’s cabin, buried in the sand.”
“Congratulations on braving the blistering sands. You must now go and delve into the hornet’s nest; overcome venom and stings, under the shade of a giant forest.”
“Maybe claws and fangs, drenched with a swamp’s poison, will deter you from finding my treasure. Or perhaps you will continue forth and be a fearless explorer.”

“If you are reading this, your tenacity is commendable. You ought to know my treasure is no mere bauble. I myself used it a long time ago to find the way on starless nights, though I imagine you will find a more warlike use for it.”
“Your final destination, and the location of my legacy, are the old docks in Abrassar. A discrete lever will open the way to my nearby treasure."
The sea breeze in the Chersonese always fills me with the urge to travel. It’s a pity that winter is so unbearably cold.
I enjoy the peace and quiet here in Enmerkar forest. It’s so quiet at night I can hear my own two hearts beat. Come, sit down and read with me, human.
The Hallowed Marsh is beautiful, but so deadly. If the enemy didn't live here I would stay for months, just watching the fireflies.
Ahhh, the wonderful heat of Abrassar. It makes me feel alive and strong! If only water was easier to come by, I would stay forever!
I hope our paths cross again on my journey. Having friendly company brightens my day.
You're a monster from the Scourge! An Immaculate!
Who are you?
Can you help me?

And? The circumstances of my creation are no one’s concern but my own. What I am, is alive. Is it my fault that my enemies stir in me an instinctual rage? I avoid contact with them for this very reason. I wish no one any harm.
Names are a human thing. My kind can tell one another apart without such arbitrary nonsense. We only call ourselves Immaculates because that's what your kind calls us.
I don't posses much, but I can offer you a piece of my survival gear. What need drives you?
I need shelter.
I need equipment.
I need storage.
I need power.
I’m fine, you probably need it more than I do.
You are considerate, human. I thank you for your concern for me.
Here, I hope this helps keep you safe and alive. I will make do without.
I've prepared you a small gift…After so many meetings it just feels right. It's a halberd that my kind uses, made safe for human hands. May it protect you from whatever means you harm.
My journey has been a little tougher lately. But I can still provide aid to you if you need it.
If your life depends on it, I will help you. But I worry that I will not be able to complete my journey at this rate.
Is something else on your mind, human?
I sense there is more to that question.
What’s your name?
What are you doing here?
You seem to enjoy reading a lot.

I am on a journey. I want to learn, I want to grow, I want to see all that this world has to offer. I would like to be free of these instinctual shackles. If I never had to harm another person or beast, again... I would be content.
Yes. The knowledge from humans long since gone is quite valuable. And the way your kind makes fake history, "stories", for the purpose of amusement... It is a comfort to me on the lonely road I walk.
Where will you go now?
Wherever I desire. Perhaps we will cross paths again someday. May you stay safe and grow strong, friendly human. The world could use more people like you.
Thank you for the chat, I’ll be off.
(A strange Totem stands here, seemingly a monument to the Five Winds. You suspect it must be a mage thing of some kind.)
(Pray for its blessing)
(Leave it be)
(You feel a strange surge of wind blow through you. The Wind in the Enmerkar region recognizes you and will obey you if you command it)
(You feel a strange surge of wind blow through you. The Wind in the Chersonese region recognizes you and will obey you if you command it)
(You feel a strange surge of wind blow through you. The Wind in the Hallowed Marsh region recognizes you and will obey you if you command it)
(You feel a strange surge of wind blow through you. The Wind in the Abrassar region recognizes you and will obey you if you command it)
(The Wind in this region already recognizes you and will obey you if you command it)
value
(The stash is empty for sure now. Try as you might, you don't find any other secret compartments full of loot.)
(This must be the stash that Yzan told you about. With a careful look, you find the hidden compartment containing the goods!)
(A metal panel is hidden beneath the wood. Five elements surface under close scrutiny : a Skull with two Stars embedded in its eyes, the Sun, a Fish and the Red Moon.)
(It looks like someone used this to hide a stash of goods.)
(The container seems smaller than it looks. Search the panels.)
It seems it was emptied long ago...
Push the Sun.
Push the Moon.
Push the Stars.
Push the Skull.
Push the Fish.
Leave.
(The lock clicks loudly and the pieces pop back into the ready position...)
(The moon clicks firmly into place.)
(The stars moves slowly in the rusty mechanism then finally gives way, revealing a secret drawer!)
(The stash consist of a purse full of coins, a dagger and a bottle.)
Nice, this stuff is coming with me!
Better leave this for now...
(The lock clicks back into place as you shut the compartment again. The stash should remain safe for now.)

Here marks where Vanasse the Lawbringer left this life behind.
His last words were “Pour a drink for me, partner!”
Drink a bottle of Gaberry Wine.
Pour a bottle of Gaberry Wine on the stone.
Coat your weapon with Gaberry Wine.
(You pay your respects to this fallen person and prepare to move on.)
(The air suddenly feels full of sadness, and the presence vanishes. You suddenly feel a little cold.)
(For a moment nothing happens, then you hear a rumble from nearby tombs! Vanasse’s spirit has taken your action as a challenge!)
(Warmth floods you, and you hear a soft laugh that isn’t your own rumble from your belly and out through your lips. All you can do is ride this feeling of warmth out, and laugh along with it.)
(As the warmth and laughter fade, and you notice a shining gem lying on top of the tomb... You’re certain it wasn’t there a moment ago.)
(You feel a strange presence here, like someone is standing beside you... Your bottle of Gaberry Wine feels hot to the touch... What will you do?)
value
I’ve got nothing to say to living people. These bones won’t be put to rest on their own!
Wait... Is that one of the ancient blue skulls you have there?! How did you get that without being torn to shreds?!
Take the skull.
Alright, look, I don’t care if you’re a grave robber or a member of the Krypteia, just gather all four for me, alright? They should have been put to rest ages ago!
Oh, perfect, let me just.... Hmm? They seem stuck together... What the...
I... think they want to come with you. Huh. You must have a knack for bringing people together!
Do not take my idol from this place! I thank you for saving it, and I would reward you handsomely if you returned it to my altar within this place.
Do not sell it to that man above. He would only see it destroyed! Return it to the altar to which it belongs, and I will reward you far greater than that man will!

I thank you mortal, for returning my likeness to its rightful place. My children will once more hear my voice with thunderous clarity! In return, I grant you this dagger. May it be your shining moon in nights to come.
Say... you share the Aberdeen’s bloodline, do you not? Perhaps we should become more... acquainted. It would benefit us both greatly.
I’ve read enough books to know this is a bad idea. No thank you!
Very well. I cannot force you. Regardless of your decision, I thank you. May you never be my enemy, Aberdeen. I have too many already.
You there! You look like a capable explorer! Might I hire you for something? I’ve heard of a blood-red Idol hidden in this place. I’ll pay you 100 silver if you bring it to me!
Here, your Idol. Watch yourself, this thing seems to talk.
I’ll keep an eye out for it.
I scoured the place and couldn’t find it. I think it’s long gone from here.
It does? Wonderful! That means it really is the genuine article! I know a woman who’ll pay really well for an artifact like this! Here, your cut. Nice working with you, stranger!
Be careful down there. The place is crawling with Burning Men, and I’m positive I saw Wendigo tracks a little further in…

Are you sure? Huh. I think I’ll go check for it myself. If you “scoured” the place like you claim, there shouldn’t be too many dangerous beasts left in here. Alright, thanks for your help. I’ll take it from here. Farewell, stranger!
Thanks for your help stranger! Here’s hoping our paths cross again someday!
value
Corruption bubbles inside these pipes... Activate the machine?
(That voice asked me to go outside and enter the door at the top of the Ziggurat. Perhaps I should take it up on it’s offer.)
(Corruption flows openly through the machine. Are there more of these machines?)
(The ground shakes and a loud “clang” comes from above. Something must have changed.)
Hmm? An interloper? Here is not safe for the likes of you. Leave my machines be, you cannot know their purpose.

Didn't I tell you to leave my machines alone? Well, activating those feeding tubes did me no harm. In the end, it seems you are no mere bumbling fool! Perhaps there's more to discuss... Use the door up at the top of my Ziggurat and come find me.
Halt! Step no further, lest you put your life in peril!
Who are you?
I am known as the Plague Doctor. I have been monitoring your progress. You show potential, or perhaps you were just born under a lucky star.

I have an offer for you. I wish to test you. Should I learn from you during this test, I will offer you ancient knowledge, lost to the mists of time. If you are brave enough to enter my crucible, I welcome you.
Test me how?
I wish to see if your potential is luck or skill. I won't try to take your life, but I can't promise your life won't be at risk. So, what do you say, visitor? Will you take my test?
I’m not interested in your test, maybe some other time.
Bring it on, I’ll take your test!
Very good. Prepare yourself, then sit upon my throne. It will take you to me. Show me what you are capable of.
(The flood of Corruption within the pipes goes from bubbling to flowing without impediment.)
Excellent. I learned much from you. It has been quite some time since I've had a duel so satisfying.
I promised you knowledge, didn't I? You are a capable warrior, so to you, I offer to forge you weapons from Tsar Stone, the most precious of gems. It is an art long since lost.
Come to me whenever you wish for such a weapon, mortal, and I shall provide.
Greetings, worthy one. Shall I create for you a weapon of Tsar Stone?
Yes, let’s get started.
Behold! Approach the weapon you wish for me to create and I shall tell you what is required in order to forge one for you. Now choose!
As you wish. Return here whenever you desire such power, and I shall provide it.
This is what I want. Please make this for me.
This is what you wish for? Very well, give me a moment to work, and it is yours.
The one handed axe, the weapon of warriors. I will require one piece of hackmanite, a palladium scrap and a tsar stone.
The greataxe, weapon of barbarians. I will require one piece of hackmanite, a palladium scrap and two tsar stones.
Ah, the elegant halberd, my favourite weapon. I will require one piece of hackmanite, a palladium scrap and two tsar stones.
The mace, weapon of cavemen and the righteous alike. I will require one piece of hackmanite, a palladium scrap and a tsar stone.
The greathammer, weapon of champions. I will require one piece of hackmanite, a palladium scrap and two tsar stones.
The shield, tool of guardians. I will require one piece of hackmanite, two palladium scraps and a tsar stone.
The spear, weapon of soldiers. I will require one piece of hackmanite, a palladium scrap and two tsar stones.
Ah, the classic sword, elegant in its simplicity. I will require one piece of hackmanite, a palladium scrap and a tsar stone.
The greatsword, weapon of the reckless and brave. I will require one piece of hackmanite, a palladium scrap and two tsar stones.
Your machines are full of Corruption! What are you doing in here?

Notice how the Corruption in the pipes flows towards me. I pump the Corruption of the marsh towards myself and I consume it. When properly channelled, it can be a source of life, twisted though it may be.
This is why I call myself the Plague Doctor. I take the world’s Corruption, toxic to your kind, and I filter, cleanse, and consume it. In this way, everyone wins.
And trust me, after that explosion of Corruption that created these nasty "Scourge" creatures, Aurai can't be picky about who does the cleaning up!
How did you become a Lich?
How were you born? I do not remember the moment of my rebirth. It's actually rather impertinent to think you can ask such a personal question.
If you feed on Corruption, how did you get by before the Scourge?

The Corruption has always been here. It is a natural part of the world. I've never had a lack of Corruption to consume. In fact, the Scourge has made things harder for me. Now there's far too much Corruption for me to deal with.
I trust that Elatt will beat the Scourge back with time, but in all honesty, he could use some help. More help than a few enhanced humans can provide at any rate.
Not one step further, bearer of Corruption! Turn back or your life is forfeit! The Light Mender will not tolerate your presence here!
I am the Light Mender. I am not someone to be trifled with. I have seen centuries pass in my time as a lich, and I will not let you sully this place with the Corruption in your very blood.
I’ll go wherever I damn well please, voice!
Not if you value your life. Turn back now, or I shall blast your bone to ash and purify you with thunder and light!
Corruption? I’m just your average human explorer, what are you talking about?
I’m with the Holy Mission, Elatt’s light is within me. How could I possibly bear Corruption?
You’re clearly not a good person. I’ll teach you a lesson, Light Mender!

Every human on this wretched world is a catalyst for the Corruption. So long as even one of your kind breathes, there can be no hope for preserving the world. The only way is to cleanse it with light and thunder!

You’re one of Elatt’s minions? Don’t make me laugh. I know the circumstances of his creation. To think his existence can be a balm against the Corruption is foolish in the extreme. He lacks the means and the heart to do what needs to be done.
So you’re planning to destroy humanity, is that it?
Corruption is a natural part of the world, though, isn’t it?
Have you been speaking to that damn Plague Doctor? He is a slave to it! He would cover the world in Corruption so he might feast endlessly! Trust his words at the world’s peril!

I would rather transform your species into something better, and will dedicate many more centuries to this plan. But if I have to choose between humanity and the existence of the world, I will choose the world. I don’t expect you to understand.
Leave. Now. You have nothing to fear from me if you depart, my plans will take centuries more to bring to fruition. But if you interfere with me, I will show you no mercy.
I know when I’m not wanted. I’ll leave.
Leave? And let you continue planning the destruction of my kind? I don’t think so.
You would fight me? Human foolishness is proven yet again! Raise your fist against me and you will be scoured clean of Corruption where you stand!
Enough! I will fight no more! You are an exceptional warrior, human. My injuries will take weeks to repair.

But know this, though you have delayed my work, you have not stopped me. I am an immortal lich. The phylactery that maintains my immortality is hidden safely from humankind. You can not slay me, no matter how hard you try!
Go on, then. Leave with your precious little victory! When my injuries have been repaired, my work will resume once again!
Then I’ll just come back in a few days and beat you down again.
So you’re saying I just have to come back in a few days to stop you again? Ok, sure.
Same time next week, then? We can do this for years, you know.
What? You’d... come back again and again just to keep me beaten down?! You monstrous, inhuman beast! Is your thirst for violence endless?
I beat you once, I can do it again. Or you can just stop what you’re doing and make this all go away.
I don’t want to, but if you’re going to keep planning to mess with my people, so help me I will!
Who’s the monstrous one, again? I’m going to enjoy breaking you over and over!

An endless circle of violence? This benefits neither of us. I have a counter-proposal, human. I will cease my work until your life has ended. If that is not enough, I have material wealth I can provide to buy your peace.

This spire is a vast collection tool for rare resources. Return every week, and I will share some of the minerals and rare ores it provides me, and I can prove to you that my work has ceased. In this way, no more violence is needed.
Alright. But if I catch even one whiff that you’re working to harm humanity...
Deal. You’d better keep your end of the bargain, lich!
Ah, now we’re talking. I’m glad we could come to a reasonable arrangement.

You can trust my word. A delay of a few decades means nothing to one who is immortal. I may not be pleased with this turn of events, but I have more to lose if I break my word to you. I am glad we could find a more efficient use of our time.
Here, as a show of good faith, you may have your first peace payment. You may choose to take three of these rare materials with you. Then leave me be!
You are here for your next payment, human?
Yes. Hand it over.
I want Tsar Stone, I don’t see any here!
Here, you may choose three of these rare materials. Then leave me in peace!

You ask for the impossible. Even with all the power in this spire, it would take centuries to create even a single one, and to collect one would be nearly as hard. No, you will have to be satisfied with what I offer.
So, what do you do with your time now?
I have returned to my old studies on mechanical creations. If I cannot continue with my intended plans, I can at least continue to perfect my means of opposing the Scourge.
If one of your servants takes a swipe at me, I’m going to break it. You realize that, right?
They are designed to be broken. How else could I test their effectiveness in combat?
Approach the sphere of your choice, and I shall tell you what it contains, and offer you the bounty within. You may choose three times before the spire’s power is spent.
It's not time for the next payment, human. Return once a week has passed.
Ammolite is a wise choice. It is difficult to find, even for me. My spire can collect one chunk of it for you, if you desire it.
Blue Sand? Humankind tells so many strange stories about the origin of this material. Even I don’t know the truth. The spire can collect two handfuls worth of this for you.
Copal, such a curious mineral. I teased the secrets from this material long ago. The spire can generate two chunks of it for you.
Ah, Hackmanite. Very strong, very durable. I have yet to completely understand it. The spire can collect for you one of such gem.
Palladium is common enough for even humans to have mastered. This spire can easily generate four scraps of it for you.
I want this.
You may still choose more materials, human.
This is all I can spare for you now. Return in a week’s time and I can provide you with more rare materials to keep our peace.
value
Hiyo! What? You've never seen a man in a barrel before? How positively sad! This is the only way to live!
Why are you in a barrel?
Why are you wearing a fish on your head?
Do you... need anything?
See you later.
Because my name is Barrelman! Where else would I be?
Because we're both lonely, of course! You should be more considerate of her poor fishy feelings!
As a matter of fact, yes! I'm a master smith who has perfected the ultimate weapon! And it's designed to share with those you love! I could really use a Mana Stone to make it happen!
Thank you! Talk to me for the next step.
A real weapon needs sauce! And nothing beats a good Gaberry Jam!
Grilled mushrooms should improve the damage dramatically, you see.
Everyone loves meat! Alpha Jerky will keep the edge sharp and the stomach full!
Here's what you asked for.
Stupendous! Just what I needed! How did you know?!
Yes, verily! Now I need some Toast!
Wait, what? What does toast have to do with-
Everything! You'll see!
Now for some sauce! We need some Gaberry jam all over this toasty base!
Sauce?! What?! What does this have to do with a weapon?!
Gaberry jam all over this toasty- Oh? Oh right, yes. Weapon. I think I'll be needing a little Palladium!
Oh good, finally something that makes sense! Why do you need that other stuff?
We desperately need some Alpha Jerky for strength and power!
Why are we talking about food again?!
Because! Try to keep up!
And last but not least, we need grilled mushrooms aaaallllll over your special request to really improve it!
No we don't! How do grilled mushrooms improve-
And at last, it is complete! And designed to share with those you love!
Wha... What is this?!
A magical floating dish that makes everyone happy! You wanted the Ultimate Dinner, right?
I can't even eat this! The crust is made of Palladium! I'd break my teeth! I could probably kill a man if I threw this at him!
Hmmm... Oh! Oh right! Now I remember, you wanted the ultimate weapon! I just got confused! Well, I guess there you have it! An ultimate weapon!
I can't use this as a weapon! Everyone will laugh at me!
Then laugh along with them! Like I do! Ahahahahaha! See, I feel better already!
Now remember, don't you EVER tell anyone about this! It's our delicious little secret, hmmm?
Hmmm... I think I need something to eat, something cheesy and bready and- Hey, did I ever tell you about my ultimate-
Yeah, you do that, Barrelman, I’m not doing that again.
Never remember, you didn't see nothing!
(There is enough energy to activate it)
(The device has already been activated)
(Activate)
(There is not enough energy to activate it)

(This arcane machine is battered, being covered in sword slashes. It still seems to have power, but something just outside this dungeon is interfering with its magical field. I should go out and look.)
(The machine activates, as the grinding of palladium gears indicates something has moved in the desert sand. Other, related, machines perhaps?)
